title: Southampton theatres scoop major awards
text:
By Hilary Porter 
TWO Southampton Theatres have won major industry awards in recognition of their "outstanding" work. 
Two members of Mayflower Theatre were named Outstanding at this year’s Technical Theatre Awards in London. 
The Nuffield and Liverpool Everyman & Playhouse’s production of The Hudsucker Proxy, meanwhile, has won the UK Theatre Award in the Best Design category. 
At the Mayflower Sara Scott Community & Education Manager won the Award for Outstanding Achievement in Education, and Robert Clayton, member of the Mayflower Technical team won the Award for Outstanding Achievement in Stage Management. 
Sara said, “I feel so privileged to work for Mayflower Theatre in their Community and Education Department. Having spent the last 20 years working in Arts Education it is fantastic to receive this award. It is very much the achievement of the whole team where over the past two and half years we have built up a packed Community and Education programme. We have established a large breadth of work and in 2014/15, 23,326 people participated in our Engage activity which includes workshops, performances, projects, show related events, Summer Youth Project and our Mayflower Musical Youth Theatre.” Promoted stories 
Robert said, “I’m delighted to receive this award, marking my 15th year in the theatre industry. What an amazing journey it has been so far! In my Stage Management career, work has taken me all over the UK and around the world. I’m delighted to be working in Newcastle this Christmas on what will be my 9th season with Qdos Entertainment, the world’s largest pantomime producer. 
As a child I remember coming to see the pantomimes at Mayflower Theatre every Christmas and saying to my family, “When I grow up, I want to work on that stage”. Ten years later, this dream became a reality.” 
Michael Ockwell, Mayflower Theatre Chief Executive added, “This is a fantastic achievement for Rob and Sara following on from our Technical team winning Best Receiving Venue at last year’s awards. I am thrilled that the hard work put in by them both has been recognised on a national level placing Mayflower Theatre yet again as one of the top Theatres in the country”. 
At the Nuffield the superb design of The Hudsucker Proxy has been rightly recognised winning the UK Theatre Award in the Best Design category. The production, which ran at Nuffield from 19-30 May 2015 and at Liverpool Everyman & Playhouse from 5-27 June 2015, featured design by Dick Bird, lighting design by Paul Keogan, and video design by Timothy Bird, and was produced in association with Complicte. The UK Theatre Awards are the only awards which celebrate outstanding achievement in theatre throughout the United Kingdom. 
The art deco design of The Hudsucker Proxy resulted in bold sets that included the giant machinery of a clock tower, a brightly illuminated art deco lift and massed filing cabinets that turn into drink dispensers. 
The Awards were presented at a ceremony at London’s historic Guildhall, a magnificent Grade 1 listed building situated in the City of London. The other nominations for the Best Design category were: 
Stewart Laing and Mimi Jordan Sherin for Titus Andronicus, a Dundee Rep production 
Leslie Travers and Tim Lutkin for Rebecca, a Kneehigh Theatre and Theatre Royal Plymouth production 
Julian Bird, Chief Executive of UK Theatre, said: “This year’s nominations recognise the vibrant, diverse and world leading theatre sector that exists here in the UK, across a broad range of venues, creative teams and performances. At this time when theatre is under continued threat due to cuts in funding it is important to demonstrate, to those making decisions about the future of arts funding in every town and city, that we continue to produce outstanding work on stages across the country.” 
Samuel Hodges, Nuffield Director said: Share article 
“It’s brilliant to have won this prestigious award from UK Theatre. It was a real honour to have such talented designers in the building, underpinning our ongoing commitment to bold and innovative design and designers, alongside playing host to this year’s Linbury Prize.” 
Nuffield is Southampton’s leading professional theatre company and this year won “Regional Theatre of the Year” at The Stage Awards 2015.
